metadata.title: Philippine Startup Ecosystem: Companies, Founders, Funding & Connections
metadata.description: Comprehensive tracking of Philippine startups, founders, funding rounds, investors, and connections to political dynasties, business networks, and elite schools
metadata.notes: Initial data collection. Tracking startups, funding, investors, and connections to power structures. Focus on notable startups, unicorns, and high-growth companies.

startups.name: Kalibrr
startups.description: Full-stack hiring platform connecting employers with job seekers across Southeast Asia. First Filipino company to participate in Y Combinator.
startups.notes: First Filipino startup in Y Combinator. Significant milestone for Philippine startup ecosystem.

startups.name: PasaJob
startups.description: Job referral platform utilizing patented long-chain technology and artificial intelligence to facilitate employment and recruitment across various industries.
startups.notes: Patented technology for job referrals. AI-powered platform.

startups.name: Pickup Coffee
startups.description: Philippine coffee shop chain that began as a delivery-centric venture. Rapidly expanded to multiple locations domestically and internationally (Mexico).
startups.notes: International expansion to Mexico. Delivery-first model.

startups.name: Kumu
startups.description: Filipino-focused live streaming and social media platform. Popular among Filipino diaspora and local users. Features live streaming, e-commerce, and social networking.

startups.name: Coins.ph
startups.description: Digital wallet and cryptocurrency platform. Provides mobile payments, remittances, and cryptocurrency trading services. Acquired by Gojek (now GoTo) in 2018.

startups.name: Mayani
startups.description: Agricultural technology platform connecting farmers directly with consumers and businesses. Streamlines supply chain and provides digital farm management tools.

startups.name: HealthNow
startups.description: Telemedicine and health services platform. Provides online consultations, medicine delivery, and health management services.

startups.name: Edukasyon.ph
startups.description: Educational technology platform helping students find schools, courses, and scholarships. Largest education platform in the Philippines.

startups.name: Investagrams
startups.description: Stock market analysis and trading platform. Provides tools for technical analysis, charting, and social trading features for Philippine stock market.

startups.name: Angkas
startups.description: Motorcycle ride-hailing and delivery service. First legal motorcycle taxi service in the Philippines. Operates in Metro Manila and other major cities.

startups.name: MetroMart
startups.description: Online grocery delivery platform. Partners with major supermarkets and retailers for same-day delivery.

startups.name: SariSuki
startups.description: Social commerce platform enabling community-based buying. Focuses on sari-sari store owners and community leaders.

organizations.name: FinTech Alliance PH
organizations.description: Non-profit industry association promoting digital innovation, financial inclusivity, and regulatory collaboration within the Philippine financial ecosystem.

accelerators_incubators.name: Y Combinator
accelerators_incubators.description: Silicon Valley accelerator. Kalibrr was first Filipino startup accepted.

investors_vcs.name: Kaya Founders
investors_vcs.description: Early-stage venture capital firm focused on backing exceptional founders in the Philippines and Southeast Asia. Focuses on seed and pre-seed investments.

investors_vcs.name: Foxmont Capital Partners
investors_vcs.description: Independent venture capital fund dedicated to empowering Filipino entrepreneurs. Focuses on fintech, e-commerce, healthtech, and digital services.

investors_vcs.name: Kickstart Ventures
investors_vcs.description: Corporate venture capital firm managing the Philippines' largest technology venture capital funds. Invests globally in early- to growth-stage tech startups.

investors_vcs.name: Gentree
investors_vcs.description: Venture capital firm affiliated with the Sy family, investing in technology-driven startups across Southeast Asia, particularly in technology, consumer, and retail sectors.

family_offices_venture_offices.name: JG Digital Equity Ventures (JGDev)
family_offices_venture_offices.description: Corporate venture capital arm of the Gokongwei group (JG Summit Holdings). $50 million venture fund focused on e-commerce, fintech, supply chain, and logistics startups.

family_offices_venture_offices.name: 917Ventures
family_offices_venture_offices.description: Corporate investment firm wholly owned by Globe Telecom (Ayala Group). Operates independently to build ventures outside of its parent's core business. GCash is its flagship product.

family_offices_venture_offices.name: AC Ventures
family_offices_venture_offices.description: Venture capital arm of Ayala Corporation, one of the Philippines' oldest and largest conglomerates. Invests in technology and innovation across various sectors.

family_offices_venture_offices.name: Aboitiz Ventures
family_offices_venture_offices.description: Venture capital and innovation arm of the Aboitiz Group, a diversified conglomerate with interests in power, banking, food, and infrastructure. Focuses on digital transformation and technology investments.

family_offices_venture_offices.name: SM Investments Ventures
family_offices_venture_offices.description: Investment arm of SM Investments Corporation (Sy family). Invests in technology startups, particularly in retail tech, fintech, and real estate technology.

family_offices_venture_offices.name: Metro Pacific Ventures
family_offices_venture_offices.description: Venture capital arm of Metro Pacific Investments Corporation. Focuses on infrastructure technology, utilities tech, and smart city solutions.

family_offices_venture_offices.name: Lopez Holdings Ventures
family_offices_venture_offices.description: Investment arm of Lopez Holdings Corporation. Focuses on media tech, power generation tech, and real estate technology investments.

family_offices_venture_offices.name: Filinvest Ventures
family_offices_venture_offices.description: Venture capital arm of Filinvest Development Corporation. Invests in real estate technology, hospitality tech, and financial technology startups.

unicorns.name: GCash
unicorns.description: Philippines' leading mobile wallet and financial services platform. Part of 917Ventures (Globe Telecom/Ayala Group).

unicorns.name: PayMaya (Maya)
unicorns.description: Digital financial services platform offering mobile wallet, payments, and banking services. Part of Voyager Innovations (PLDT/Smart).

unicorns.name: OVOVTEC
unicorns.description: One Village, One Volunteer: Trained, Educated, and Community-Centered, Concerned Citizen Confronting Corruption in Construction. Youth-led citizen-powered platform to document public construction projects and combat corruption in infrastructure. Uses crowdsourced reporting from vetted local experts who rate projects on completion, quality, and functionality. Plans to integrate AI for automated construction quality assessment.

founders.name: Gian Alingog
founders.background: Computer Science awardee from Ateneo de Manila (2023), silver medalist at national computer science competition (NOI.PH). Currently Computer Science major at University of California.
awards: Silver medalist, NOI.PH national computer science competition

unicorns.mission: To empower citizens as active stewards of public infrastructure by providing a platform that crowdsources transparency. OVOVTEC's mission is to ensure every government-funded construction project is openly documented and assessed, so that corruption, substandard work, and 'ghost projects' are brought to light and addressed.
unicorns.vision: A transparent Philippines (and eventually a transparent world) where every village has a voice and no public project goes unwitnessed.
unicorns.notes: Open source civic tech platform focused on infrastructure transparency and anti-corruption. Founded by a young Filipino computer science student inspired by 'ghost projects' in flood control infrastructure. Represents a growing trend of youth-led civic technology initiatives in the Philippines.

government_support.name: DTI Startup Development Program
government_support.description: Government initiative supporting startup development through funding, mentorship, and regulatory support.

government_support.name: BOI Startup Incentives
government_support.description: Tax incentives and benefits for registered startups and technology companies.

government_support.name: Innovative Startup Act (Republic Act 11337)
government_support.description: Legislation providing tax incentives, visa support, and funding for innovative startups. Enacted in 2019.

government_support.name: Philippine Innovation Act (Republic Act 11293)
government_support.description: Framework for promoting innovation and technology development in the Philippines.

regulatory_environment.name: Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas (BSP)
regulatory_environment.description: Central bank regulating fintech, digital payments, and financial services. Issues licenses for e-money issuers and payment systems.
regulatory_environment.impact_on_startups: Fintech startups require BSP licenses for payment services. Regulatory sandbox available for testing.

regulatory_environment.name: National Privacy Commission (NPC)
regulatory_environment.description: Regulates data privacy and protection. Enforces Data Privacy Act of 2012.
key_regulations: NPC Circulars on Data Breach Notification
regulatory_environment.impact_on_startups: All startups handling personal data must comply with data privacy requirements.

regulatory_environment.name: Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC)
regulatory_environment.description: Regulates securities, corporate registration, and crowdfunding. Oversees startup incorporation.
regulatory_environment.impact_on_startups: Startups must register with SEC. Crowdfunding regulations affect fundraising.

regulatory_environment.name: Land Transportation Franchising and Regulatory Board (LTFRB)
regulatory_environment.description: Regulates transportation services including ride-hailing and delivery services.
regulatory_environment.impact_on_startups: Mobility startups like Angkas, Grab require LTFRB permits and compliance.

co_working_spaces_incubators.name: IdeaSpace Foundation
co_working_spaces_incubators.description: Technology incubator and accelerator founded by the PLDT Group. Provides funding, mentorship, and workspace for early-stage startups.

co_working_spaces_incubators.name: QBO Innovation Hub
co_working_spaces_incubators.description: Public-private partnership incubator supported by DTI, DOST, and IdeaSpace. Focuses on tech startups and innovation.

co_working_spaces_incubators.name: Impact Hub Manila
co_working_spaces_incubators.description: Co-working space and community for social entrepreneurs and impact-driven startups.

co_working_spaces_incubators.name: Launchgarage
co_working_spaces_incubators.description: Co-working space and startup community hub in Manila.

co_working_spaces_incubators.name: U.P.–Ayala Land TechnoHub
co_working_spaces_incubators.description: Technology park and business district in Quezon City. Houses tech companies, BPOs, and startups. Partnership between UP and Ayala Land.

co_working_spaces_incubators.name: HUB: Make Lab
co_working_spaces_incubators.description: Incubator space for creative startups and artists in Manila.

education_pipeline.name: University of the Philippines
education_pipeline.description: Premier state university. Produces many tech founders and entrepreneurs. Strong engineering and business programs.

education_pipeline.name: Ateneo de Manila University
education_pipeline.description: Leading private university. Strong business and technology programs. Many founders from Ateneo.

education_pipeline.name: De La Salle University
education_pipeline.description: Major private university with strong engineering and business programs. Active in startup ecosystem.

education_pipeline.name: Mapua University
education_pipeline.description: Leading engineering and technology university. Produces many tech talent and entrepreneurs.

angel_investors.name: Paulo Campos III
angel_investors.description: Co-founder of Zalora Philippines and Kaya Founders. Active angel investor in Philippine startups.

angel_investors.name: Lance Gokongwei
angel_investors.description: CEO of JG Summit Holdings. Active in technology investments through JG Digital Equity Ventures.
angel_investors.background: Gokongwei family, CEO of JG Summit

international_vcs.name: Gobi Partners
international_vcs.description: Pan-Asian venture capital firm with strong presence in Southeast Asia. Active investor in Philippine startups.

international_vcs.name: General Atlantic
international_vcs.description: Global growth equity firm. Invested in Kumu (Series B).

international_vcs.name: OpenSpace Ventures
international_vcs.description: Southeast Asian venture capital firm. Invested in Kumu and other Philippine startups.

international_vcs.name: Wavemaker Partners
international_vcs.description: Early-stage venture capital firm with offices in Los Angeles and Singapore. Invests in B2B and B2B2C startups in Southeast Asia.

international_vcs.name: Omidyar Network
international_vcs.description: Philanthropic investment firm. Invests in companies that create social impact, including in the Philippines.

international_vcs.name: 500 Startups
international_vcs.description: Global venture capital firm and accelerator. Has invested in several Philippine startups.

international_vcs.name: Sequoia Capital
international_vcs.description: Global venture capital firm. Limited presence in Philippines but tracks Southeast Asian market.

exits.description: Acquired by Indonesian ride-hailing and payments company Gojek (now GoTo Group).

connections_to_power_structures.note: Initial data collection. Research needed to identify connections between startups, founders, and political dynasties, business networks, and elite schools.

next_steps: Research accelerator and incubator programs in Philippines
Identify venture capital firms investing in Philippine startups
Add more detailed metrics for major platforms (Lazada, Shopee, Grab)
